main event: On 5 March 1955, a circular, bright purple object was observed rising from the ground and disappearing in Colorado Springs.
interesting points: The object was the size of a basketball when held at arm's length., The observation lasted for several seconds., Police investigation revealed a burned condition in the area where the object was seen., There were two observation attempts with some reports of appearances and disappearances., Conclusions varied with assessments of it possibly being a balloon or aircraft.
witness description: Captain ASML Rees, an active duty member of the U.S. Army.
